Job Title: Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery (BC/DR) Lead - Must Go Onsite Hybrid In Chicago

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Description: (HYBRID IN CHICAGO) 

 Proven experience as an IT BC/DR Lead, with a focus on information security applications. Strong understanding of information security principles, practices, and technologies. Experience in developing and implementing BC/DR plans for complex IT environments, specifically addressing security applications. Familiarity with relevant regulations and standards related to BC/DR and information security. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to lead initiatives from conception to completion. Effective communication skills to articulate complex BC/DR concepts and requirements to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Relevant certifications such as CBCP (Certified Business Continuity Professional) or similar are highly desirable. Bachelor’s degree in IT, Information Security, or a related field.


 Responsibilities 

 Develop and implement comprehensive Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery plans specific to information security applications. Lead risk assessments to identify potential threats to the availability and integrity of security applications and formulate mitigation strategies. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment between information security, BC/DR, and overall IT strategies. Conduct regular testing and simulations of BC/DR plans to validate their effectiveness and identify areas for improvement. Establish and maintain documentation for BC/DR procedures, including clear escalation paths and communication plans. Coordinate with stakeholders to define recovery time objectives (RTOs) and recovery point objectives (RPOs) for information security applications. Provide training and awareness programs to ensure that relevant teams are well-prepared to execute BC/DR plans when needed. Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging threats, and best practices in BC/DR and information security.


 About TEKsystems 

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
